location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letters from claimants to the succession of Baroda State 1875

physicalDescription.extent: The contents of the file have been arranged in chronological order.
Foliation: The file has been foliated using a pencil number enclosed in a circle located in the top right hand corner of the recto of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file primarily contains letters from relatives of Mulharrao, Gaekwar of Baroda, who wished to present their claims to the succession in Baroda should Mulharrao be deposed.Also contained within the file are a petition from the Sirdars to the Agent to the Governor-General at Baroda, Philip Sandys Melvill, regarding the actions of the Dewan, Sir T Madhava Rao which had reduced their rights and privileges; and correspondence from Damodhur Trinbuck Nanay, formerly the private secretary to the Gaekwar regarding a guarantee issued by Sir Lewis Pelly in 1875 to protect his person and property.

name.namePart: Agent to the Governor-General of India, Baroda
Maharaja Gaekwad of Baroda Sayaji Rao III Gaekwad
